title: Announcement, Lines: New Writing Series at the Detroit Institute of Arts, 1986
title_raw: Lines: New Writing Series at the Detroit Institute of Arts
signed: Signature imprinted in blue, recto, lower right corner, sideways: DESIGN: EDWARD FELLA
inscribed:
Recto: Imprinted in blue and brown at various angles: JANUARY/FEBRUARY 1986 LINES presents:/ New Writing at The Detroit Institute of Arts/ OPEN FIELD SERIES/ Sunday/January 26 Nubia KAI Detroit/ author of...[lists presenters with short biographical information, date, time]... Admission $3.00; brown, diagonally across center, running upward: The Open Field Series is made possible by a grant from the Arts Foundation of Michigan For Information call LINES: 833-1858; blue, across upper right quadrant, running upward, sideways: POETRY ON THE RADIO both on WDET FM 102; in brown across upper right edge, running upward, diagonally: "Dimension"/ Sundays/ 11:00p.m. to 1:00a.m./ "City Arts Review"/ Fridays/ 12:00 midnight to 3:00a.m.; blue and brown across lower left quadrant, running upward, sideways: HAPPY NEW YEAR from LINES: 1986; blue, diagonally across lower left quadrant, running upward: "all day the rain tossed my boat against the shore/ but ecstasy was a mirror/ with a narrow frame/ I could pass through like a door/ arrive at some new place"-- Lewis Warsh  
Verso: Imprinted in blue at various angles across upper right quadrant, upside down: 26/ Sunday/ January reading/ NUBIA KAI/ 12/ Wednesday/ February reading/ JUAN CORONEL/ 16/ Sunday/ February reading/ THOM JUREK/ 27/ Thursday/ February readings/ MICHAEL PALMER & DIANE WARD; across upper left quadrant, running downward, sideways: JANUARY / FEBRUARY 1986 : New Writing at The Detroit Institute of Arts; across lower left quadrant, running downward, sideways: LINES; across lower left quadrant: THE DETROIT INSTITUTE OF ARTS 5200 Woodward Avenue/ Detroit, Michigan  48202; across lower right quadrant: Non-Profit Organization/ U.S. Postage/ PAID/ Founders Society/ Detroit Institute of Arts
description:
Poster/ announcement printed in blue and brown, for lecture series at Detroit Institute of Arts, designed to be mailed.  
Recto: Across upper half of sheet, text in blue and brown, at various angles, locations, times, admission cost, and additional information.  Across lower left quadrant, Lewis Warsh quote.  Across lower right quadrant, abstract image.  
Verso: Upper right corner, upside down, calendar grid with dates and events marked on appropriate squares.  Across lower half of sheet, blue text giving mailing information.

tombstone.epitaph:
Announcement, Lines: New Writing Series at the Detroit Institute of Arts, 1986. Offset lithograph on off-white paper.. 
Gift of Edward Fella. 1995-42-43
